io.jeo.vector

Class SchemaBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.jeo.vector.SchemaBuilder

  • public class SchemaBuilder
extends Object
    Builder for Schema objects.

    Example usage: 

     Schema schema = new SchemaBuilder("cities").field("loc", Point.class, "epsg:4326")
      .field("name", String.class).field("pop", Integer.class).schema();

    Author:
    Justin Deoliveira, OpenGeo

      • fields

        public SchemaBuilder fields(String spec)
        Adds fields to the schema being built described by a GeoTools style schema specification of the form: 
        <name>:<type>[:srid=<srid>][,...]
        Parameters:
        spec - String describing the schema.
        Returns:
        This builder.

      • property

        public SchemaBuilder property(String key,
                     Object value)
        Adds a property to be set on the next field.

        This value is discarded after the next call to field()

        Parameters:
        key - The property key.
        value - The property value.
        See Also:
        Field#property(String, Class)}

      • schema

        public Schema schema()
        Returns the built schema.

      • select

        public static Schema select(Schema original,
            Iterable<String> fields)
        Create a new Schema with only the specified fields. Fields not present in the original with be ignored. The order of the fields will be retained except those that are removed.
        Parameters:
        original - The original Schema
        fields - The fields to retain
        Returns:
        a new Schema with only the specified fields

        Returns:
        The new schema.

      • renameFields

        public static Schema renameFields(Schema original,
                  Map<String,String> renames)
        Creates a new Schema with renamed fields.
        Parameters:
        original - The original schema.
        renames - Set of fields to rename, key specifies original field name, value specifies new name.
        Returns:
        The new schema.
